name: Eiffel Tower
description: Iconic iron lattice tower on the Champ de Mars in Paris, France.

name: Machu Picchu
description: Ancient Inca city set high in the Andes Mountains in Peru.

name: Great Wall of China
description: Series of fortifications and walls built across the historical northern borders of ancient Chinese states.

name: Taj Mahal
description: An ivory-white marble mausoleum on the right bank of the river Yamuna in Agra, India.

name: Colosseum
description: Oval amphitheatre in the centre of the city of Rome, Italy.

name: Petra
description: Ancient city famous for its rock-cut architecture in southern Jordan.

name: Christ the Redeemer
description: Art Deco statue of Jesus Christ in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.

name: Statue of Liberty
description: Symbol of freedom and democracy located on Liberty Island in New York City.

name: Stonehenge
description: Prehistoric monument consisting of a ring of standing stones in Wiltshire, England.

name: Sydney Opera House
description: Multi-venue performing arts center located on Bennelong Point in Sydney, Australia.

name: Santorini
description: A picturesque island known for its stunning sunsets and whitewashed buildings.

name: Grand Canyon
description: A steep-sided canyon carved by the Colorado River in Arizona, USA.

name: Niagara Falls
description: Famous waterfalls located on the border between Canada and the USA.

name: Burj Khalifa
description: The tallest building in the world located in Dubai, UAE.

name: Acropolis of Athens
description: Ancient citadel containing several buildings of great architectural and historic significance.

name: Big Ben
description: The nickname for the Great Bell of the clock at the north end of the Palace of Westminster in London.

name: Sagrada Familia
description: A large unfinished Roman Catholic basilica in Barcelona, Spain designed by architect Antoni Gaud√≠.

name: Angkor Wat
description: A temple complex in Cambodia and one of the largest religious monuments in the world.

name: Pyramids of Giza
description: The oldest of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World and the only one to remain largely intact.

name: Mount Fuji
description: An iconic strato-volcano and Japan"s highest peak.
